content.title: Integrated Sheep Development Scheme
content.beneficiary: Individual / Group of Individuals / Self Help Groups / Cooperative Societies / Farmers Producer Organizations
content.details: The Integrated Sheep Development Scheme (ISDS) was launched in the year 2020-21 by the J&K Government to promote income generation through the establishment of sheep & goat units. The scheme is implemented through Sheep Husbandry Department and monitored by the concerned Director. The support shall be available for the following activities - a) Establishment of Sheep/goat units under participatory mode comprising 10 ewes/does b) Establishment of Sheep/goat units on subsidy mode (20-200 ewes/does) c) Establishment of shearing units. Efforts will be made to cover 20% SC/ST and 10% women beneficiaries. The guidelines will be in force till 31st March 2023 or replaced by a new set of guidelines whichever is earlier.
benefits: Participatory Mode: Selected beneficiaries shall be provided 10 ewes free of cost and from 3rd year onwards 2 ewes/does shall be retrieved for the next 5 years.
Subsidy Mode: Selected beneficiaries shall be entitled to a 50% subsidy for the establishment of sheep/goat units of 20-200 ewes/does.
Shearing Units: Selected beneficiaries shall be entitled to a 50% subsidy for the purchase of a shearing unit consisting of a shearing machine, Genset & shearing spares.
eligibility: Any Individual / Group of Individuals / Self Help Group / Cooperative Society / Farmers Producer Organization.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested beneficiaries shall submit their applications in the format 'Annexure B' to their respective District Sheep Husbandry Officer (DSHO) along with a self-attested copy of the required documents.
documents_required: Proof of Identity (Voters ID Card / Passport / Driving Licence / PAN Card / Aadhaar Card)
Proof of Address (Recent Electricity Bill / Voters ID Card / Passport / Aadhaar Card / Ration card)
Copy of Land Record Holding (Revenue Department)
Photograph of the Livestock Shed (attested by PRI Member)
Application Form for the Establishment of 10 EWE/DOE Units under Participatory Mode (Annexure-B)
Affidavit (to be attested by 1st Class Magistrate) (Annexure-D)
Application Form for the Establishment of 20-200 EWE/DOE Units under Subsidy Mode (Annexure-F)
Application Form for the Establishment of Shearing Units (Annexure-G)

faqs.question: When was the Integrated Sheep Development Scheme (ISDS) launched?
faqs.answer: Integrated Sheep Development Scheme (ISDS) was launched in the year 2020-21.

faqs.question: Which department launched the ISDS Scheme?
faqs.answer: The ISDS scheme was launched by the Sheep Husbandry Department of the J&K Government.

faqs.question: Under what activities shall the support be provided?
faqs.answer: The support shall be available for the following activities - a) Establishment of Sheep/goat units under participatory mode comprising 10 ewes/does b) Establishment of Sheep/goat units on subsidy mode (20-200 ewes/does) c) Establishment of shearing units.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply to this scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary can be an Individual / Group of Individuals / Self Help Groups / Cooperative Societies / FPOs, etc. Efforts will be made to cover 20% SC/ST and 10% women beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Till which year will the scheme guidelines be in force?
faqs.answer: The Guidelines Will Be In Force Till 31st March 2023 Or Replaced By A New Set Of Guidelines Whichever Is Earlier.

faqs.question: Is there an earmarking for SC/ST And Women applicants?
faqs.answer: Efforts will be made to cover 20% SC/ST and 10% women beneficiaries.

faqs.question: What benefits are provided under Subsidy Mode?
faqs.answer: Subsidy Mode: Selected beneficiaries shall be entitled to a 50% subsidy for the establishment of sheep/goat units of 20-200 ewes/does.

faqs.question: What shall be the pattern of assistance under the Establishment Of Sheep/Goat Units?
faqs.answer: Pattern of Assistance under Establishment Of Sheep/Goat Units (25 Sheep/Goat Per Unit): 50% of the unit cost as total eligible subsidy with a ceiling of ₹ 1,00,000 whichever is less per unit (25 sheep/goat) and a maximum subsidy ceiling of ₹ 8,00,000 for 8 Sheep/Goat units (each unit comprising 25 sheep/goats).

faqs.question: How much land is required to start a 25 EWEs Sheep Unit?
faqs.answer: 8 sq. ft. per animal, it is the accurate space required per animal, so for 25 EWEs, you may need 200 sq. ft. shed.
